content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Cairnhill Single Member Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(July 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Cairnhill Single Member Constituency** (SMC) was a former single member constituency in Singapore. It used to exist from 1955 to 1988 as **Cairnhill Constituency** and was renamed as **Cairnhill Single Member Constituency** (SMC) as part of Singapore's political reforms. The SMC was merged into [Kampong Glam Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Kampong_Glam_Group_Representation_Constituency) (GRC) in 1991. [Lim Kim San](/wiki/Lim_Kim_San) was the elected Member of Parliament from 1959 to 1980 and then Wong Kwei Cheong from 1980 to 1991. ## History The constituency was formed during the [1955 Singaporean general election](/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election), encompassing [Balestier](/wiki/Balestier_Constituency), [Rochore](/wiki/Rochore_Constituency) and [Tanglin](/wiki/Tanglin_Single_Member_Constituency) wards. During the [1959 Singaporean general election](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election), part of the constituency was split to form [River Valley Constituency](/wiki/River_Valley_Constituency). In 1988, the constituency was renamed Cairnhill Single Member Constituency as part of Singapore's political reforms and also absorbed River Valley Constituency back. In 1991, the constituency was abolished and merged into Kampong Glam GRC. ## Member of Parliament YearMemberParty[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)(/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election)[David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician))[LF](/wiki/Labour_Front)(/wiki/1957_Singaporean_by-elections)Soh Ghee Soon[LSP](/wiki/Liberal_Socialist_Party_(Singapore))(/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election)[Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock)[SPA](/wiki/Singapore_People%27s_Alliance)(/wiki/1963_Singaporean_general_election)[Lim Kim San](/wiki/Lim_Kim_San)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)(/wiki/1968_Singaporean_general_election)[Lim Kim San](/wiki/Lim_Kim_San)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)(/wiki/1972_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election)Wong Kwei Cheong(/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election) ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in the 1950s [General Election
